reviews.review_msg: Really interesting class. Really nice, helpful, interesting prof. Labs are easy. Midterm and final were easy if you read the text and watched the videos. I liked it better when he didn't have power point because he drew out diagrams on the blackboard and was more interactactive. Good at explaining and keeping the examples relevant and interesting.

Had him for economic and service activities.  Hard tests, hard marker, expects a lot.  Lot of the assigned readings were in my opinion above 2nd/3rd yr undergrad level. Not a horrible prof, but his expectations are high.  If you want a good mark you have to devote an above average amount of time to his courses, which not everyone can afford to do.

Horrible prof ... completely unhelpful and midterm and final weren't even well related to topics covered in class. Also, tutorials were a total waste of time as they didn't even relate to what was covered in lecture. AVIOD TAKING HIM FOR ANY COURSE!

after the midterm exam he totally slacked off in regards to lecture...he never had powerpt notes nor were the lectures interesting nemore and it showed in the final exam...most of the MC questions were useless info from the text that we didnt even go over...thanks for wasting my  2nd half of the semester !!!

final exam was a total waste of time...most of the multiple choice  qs were stupid facts from the text (he didnt even go over info in the text pretty much) totally useless when questioned his marking on midterm (didnt want to be bothered to change marks) TA was kinda weird too
Josh is a good TA, this course would have been boring without him in the mix, topic discussion was interesting, around if you needed help with anything.
Great TA. Interesting, insightful and engaging.
Clear, easy to follow, very accessible. Made class fun.

Rosemary is such a good prof. She tries to answer as many questions as she can and tries to learn students names. There are only 3 assignments for the whole semester and each are simple/ straightforward and very interesting. I did well on the exams without reading most of the readings, however you have to attend and take good notes during lecture

Rosemary is a great lecturer, she is super engaging and fun. She is always willing to answer questions, even if it means the class runs longer than expected. Grading is fairly weighted and her assignments are manageable. Super interesting course content once all the ground work is laid down.

Rosemary is such a sweet professor. She is so passionate abt what she teaches its so fun listening to her lectures. HEAVY CONTENT. Attend lectures bc she only posts lecture outlines. one of the few 2 hr lectures that i can get thru w/o losing focus, thats how interesting her lectures are and also bc she doesnt post detailed slides haha.

Rosemary is very passionate about the courses she teaches. She only posts lecture slide outlines, so I would recommend attending every class or you'll miss a LOT of important content. Tests had hard fill in the blank questions, but the rest was fairly easy if you studied.
Talks really fast and seems cluttered, clear lecture notes that get posted, The TA's are the best, were very good markers and were helpful.
I honestly thought this class was going to be boring but Geoff made the material relatable and interesting. I learned a lot in this class that will stick with me.

He is very passionate about what he teaches! His lectures are interesting to sit through. There would be times where in lecture he would go off on many tangents, however it all related back to course material. There was no midterm exam, just a few straightforward assignments and a take home final.

Great professor who kept things interesting. His lecture style was a first for me. He rarely relied on his own notes and even admitted to keeping on track of the notes. Fun little stories also kept you interested. His class was easy, as long as you have a basic understanding of economics,

Geoff is a very enthusiastic guy.  He knows his stuff and is a good lecturer.  I personally did not like this class or his teaching style. His exams and marking was tough.  If you like good lectures and don't mind a low gpa go ahead take his class.

Geoff Mann is really one of the best profs at SFU. like other people said, he is so passionate about the stuff he teaches and thus makes it that more interesting. i wish i could take more courses with him but i'm not a geo major
Best prof in the Geography department. Makes a boring class really interesting. Didn't want to take this course but turned out to be my favorite one.  All profs should be like him.
Geoff is one of the best professors at SFU. His enthusiasm for the subject makes for lectures that are extremely interesting and informative.
Geoff is the best prof around. He's an enthusiastic funny guy.Makes geography interesting. Definitely take any class he's teaching. Need more prof's like him!!
awesome prof...boring material, but he made the class so interesting. he's the best prof i've ever had. g.mann for president!!

Ever get tired of those profs that read off powerpoints and bore you into insanity? Then this guy is the perfect medication. He is the most energetic prof that I've ever met. Highly recommended for people who want some relevence to the things that they learn in geography with your lives. He has countless stories to tell to make the lecture fun.
One of the best professors I have ever had! He's a great lecturer and makes it all relevant to current events. Pretty damn funny and entertaining too.
Easy A.
really boring, hard tests, easy essays but he doesn't mark them the TA does, textbook is boring,uses ancient charts and writes on overhead, extremely outdated but knows his stuff

He is a nice guy, relatively straight forward class. The TA marks the essays a bit hard considering the instructions were so vague. The exams are a lot of memorization, so make sure to study hard! If you have taken Micro or Macro this course will be an Easy A. It can be hard though, but overall not that bad.

He's a super nice professor, and extremely helpful whenever you make an effort to go to him. The exam's are just memorizing the terms and concepts, pretty straight forward stuff. Not too hard to get an A.

I don't know why people were saying this class was hard.  I put a decent amount of effort into it and managed to get an A+.  Exams were straight memorization of terms/main concepts and extremely fair.  The paper took quite a bit of work, but the subject matter involved was very interesting.  I would definitely take another class with Roger.

Not sure how I ended up with a C in the course because I did work reasonably hard. But the class was just really hard to follow and almost a chore to actively participate in. The textbook was full of typos and grammatical errors that obscured its actual contents. Exams were fair. Professor is nice and knowledgeable, but not the best educator.

One of the worst class i have ever taken at SFU . Avoid all professors who use the book they wrote. We had to read his entire damn book that was as thick as a phone book! Had to buy the non refundable $90 custom courseware, unedited useless book. The exams are mostly MC, easy if you read and memorized the whole book which is near impossible!

what a brutal class.. prof still writing the text, we had to buy it chapter by chapter! exams were fair, but class torturous (boring, and Hayter all over the place, disorganized).  I'd reccommendthe class based on content, but not with this prof

Honestly, Roger could make any subject interesting. He's interesting to listen to, has a great amount of knowledge, and is really interested in the material. It was an early morning class and he kept me awake the whole time!
not the most organized...but pretty hilarious. Class was easy to follow; he seems to really know his stuff.
he's got good stories .... lectures were kinda boring exams were easy.

Almost too knowledgeable. Funny on the one hand, difficult to keep track of what he is trying to teach on the other. His knowledge was more interesting than the subject he was trying to teach (Economic Geography).
Brutal teacher.  Terrible organizatioon.
No Comments
He's very unclear with just about everything
No Comments
This man often loses topic, and quizes on seemingly unimportant details

Honestly? Loved this course way more than I expected. Dr. Roderick is super chill but really knows her stuff. Assignments were clear, instructions were posted early, and if anything was confusing, she explained it fast.  Would totally take another class with her!

Dr. Roderick was really kind & clearly very smart, which came across in her lecture material. Assignments could get pretty lengthy, but were not difficult content-wise. Very lenient marker! I have recommended many people to take a course with her if possible.

This is my second geog class with Dr. Roderick. She is a fantastic lecturer and makes the course content easy to absorb and the assignments fun to do. She brings many perspectives and really emphasizes critical thinking and open mindedness. I would highly recommend her as a prof.
The course was amazing with field trips and group assignments. She makes the class exciting and fun through the in-class activities. Overall pretty easy and entertaining course experience.

The course was pretty fun; in-class activities, a field trip, and encouraged participation. Dr. Roderick is a very caring professor who structures her class to provide students with as much time and as many resources as possible. Overall pretty easy and entertaining course experience.

would not recommend this class with John. Lectures were not useful. The content in them provides you with minimal information. Read the textbook, do well on the assignment and hope you do ok on the final. Very unorganized. Got so behind on the syllabus. Studying for the final is very difficult b/c you have no idea what he talks about in class

Lectures were very dry. He was very very behind on his syllabus. We were 2 lectures behind at one point, and watched half a movie instead. He doesn't use Canvas or tell you anything about the TA. He marks pretty easy, minimal effort can be put into assignments to get a good grade. I would not take another class with him. It was too much for me.

John is a nice guy and is passionate and knlowedgable on the concepts, but hes teaching style wasnt my favourite. Lectures are tough to sit through but he sends slides before the midterm and final. 3 small written assignments(1000 words) that were decently easy and interesting

He liked to go off on tangents in every class. He is also very opinionated about social issues and goes off talking about stuff he doesn't actually know about (ended up talking about gun laws because of what happened in Vegas). Does not actually post slides, even tho he says he will. Dull lectures.

John has awful communication skills and will generally take a week to respond to e-mails, no matter how important. He goes off on tangents are does not give clear learning outcomes. Someone needs to have a serious talk with him about his teaching, because he inhibits the ability to learn and enjoy learning.

John is a knowledgeable, kind of passionate professor. he shared experiences to us which is very relevant to the topic. insightful, helpful and give you a fair to good marks as a whole. recomment this prof if you want to learn something. don't treat this course as gpa booter though, but it will definitely not dropping your gpa

Despite his monotone way of talking, he's very interesting, insightful and passionate, and cares a lot about students. His stories are usually examples related to the slides, so if you can type fast enough they provide a useful tool for understanding the material. I've had him twice and he's sent out lecture slides very close to the exam date

Lectures are a bit boring. However, he has an interesting personality, with lots of personal stories. You must write down the slides as he does not send them. The final was slightly tricky. Overall I recommend him

He is a bit boring and monotone but he defiantly knows his material and is a smart guy. The papers in this course were marked so easy (3 small papers overall) but the exams were difficult.Try to stay on top of the textbook chapters & study really hard. You can get by with getting good grads on papers, a good grade on tutorial and a OK grade on exam

This dude is boring.  His lectures are recorded only.  He doesn't provide you with the ppts.  You better come to class with a laptop because if you're gonna write notes on hand, you'd better write at the speed of light.

he is the worst prof ever. always goes on tangents and refers to philosophers I've never even heard of. reading requirements were way too much.  he throws a lot of notes at you and you never have time to write them all down. he needs to slow down a little.  i would not recommend this guy at all.
